intro: Microlicia morrensis, commonly known as the Morren’s microlicia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow leaves. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its blooming period typically occurs during the spring and early summer months. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Microlicia morrensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
